segments.text: It's such a nice day outside . Let ’ s take a walk into town and do some window-shopping .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: You know I hate shopping more than anything else in this world .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I know . But we could get some exercise in , and we could get some errands run , too . Window-shopping won ’ t cost you anything .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: What kind of errands do we need to run ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well , we could go to the newsagent's to pick up the Sunday paper , go to the butcher's to pick up a chicken for a roast dinner , and to the chemist's to pick up your prescription from the doctor .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I'll only go if we can stop at the office-license to pick up something to drink for tonight .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Fine , we'll do that on the way home , so we don ’ t have to carry it the whole time .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Sounds good . You have to promise not go into any of the stores in the mall though . I know how you like to try things on in the fitting rooms , especially if the stores have special offers .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I promise . We're only going for a walk to get some exercise and to get some things done that we haven ’ t had time for .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: For our errands , and maybe a little extra for something from a vendor on the street .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: You said you were only going to window shop !
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I agreed to not go into the mall , but I can still look at things in the market !
segments.speaker: S1
